instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Is this GPU Failure?
threads.message:
Working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that fails a ton of external video tests only (all internal pass, MUX tests pass, but 8 or 9 external video tests--mainly the rendering tests--fail, etc), and board performs OK until under even moderate stress, then it starts artifacting. I've uploaded a short video showing the anomaly which can be seen here: [URL]https://imgur.com/a/YN2Zc9P[/URL]

I have hope it may not be GPU, only because I've NEVER seen this particular type of artifacting on this board. The blue triangles show constantly while running heaven, but no anomalies when just performing normal tasks, so I don't think it's the GMUX either. Was suspecting damage to board, but no caps or anything missing from GPU face or area of board. Now thinking possibly VRAM.

Any ideas? Should I reflow GPU or is this a bad chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Is this GPU Failure?
threads.message:
Does it run heaven OK on internal LCD?
Be sure to switch on GPU mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Is this GPU Failure?
threads.message: No, these artifacts (in the video) [I][U]are[/U][/I] on the internal LCD. I haven't even bothered testing external functionality yet, because the internal is distorted as shown, etc. :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Is this GPU Failure?
threads.message:
"board that fails a ton of external video tests only (all internal pass"
I understood totally other thing...

Reflow VRAM and see if change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Is this GPU Failure?
threads.message: Thanks! Yes, it's confusing; it fails external video tests in ASD, but the artifacting shows on the internal LCD under stress. I'll reflow and confirm--thank you! Sorry for any confusion, but yes it's certainly confusing. I was hoping to find damage around the GMUX, but no luck.
